alert.note: Alert for Garrett (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued November 18 at 5:02PM EST until November 18 at 5:45PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EST FOR NORTHERN GARRETT COUNTY... At 502 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located near Friendsville, or 15 miles north of Terra Alta, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous and life-threatening travel conditions are expected to develop rapidly in the warning area. I-68 through northern Garrett County, Maryland. Locations impacted include... Bittinger, Grantsville, Friendsville, Accident, Merrill, Selbysport, New Germany, Piney Grove, Keysers Ridge, Jennings and Mineral Spring. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.
